TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SnapLinePriority extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the relative importance of a snapline.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A snapline's priority acts as a suggestion to visual designers about how to treat a snapline with respect to its peers. The layout engine uses a simple method of determining whether to display the snaplines for a control: only the highest priority snaplines, including those with a value of Always, are shown for each orientationâ€”vertical or horizontal.
To set the priority of a snapline, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.SnapLinePriority.Always> enumeration is specified when creating an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.SnapLinePriority> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.SnapLinePriority Always = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The priority category that is equivalent to the highest priority of all the current snaplines. Indicates that this category of snapline should always be active.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.SnapLinePriority High = int32(3)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.SnapLinePriority Low = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.SnapLinePriority Medium = int32(2)
